nu.nerd.entitymeta

Class EntityMetaAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • nu.nerd.entitymeta.EntityMetaAPI

  • public final class EntityMetaAPI
extends Object
    This is the public API for accessing type-safe, persistent entity metadata.

    In a nutshell: 

     // Example: Store a UUID, Location and double in an entity.
 Plugin myPlugin;
 Entity entity;
 Player owner;
 
 EntityMeta.api().set(entity, myPlugin, "owner", owner.getUniqueId());
 EntityMeta.api().set(entity, myPlugin, "location", owner.getLocation());
 EntityMeta.api().set(entity, myPlugin, "chance", 1.2345);
 
 // Example: Retrieve my metadata.
 UUID ownerUuid = (UUID) EntityMeta.api().get(entity, myPlugin, "owner");
 Location location = (Location) EntityMeta.api().get(entity, myPlugin, "location");
 double chance = (Double) EntityMeta.api().get(entity, myPlugin, "chance");
 
 // Example: Enumerate all metadata set by a specific plugin.
 String pluginName = "SomePlugin";
 for (Entry<String, MetadataEntry> entry : EntityMeta.api().getPluginEntries(entity, pluginName)) {
     String key = entry.getKey(); // e.g. "SomePlugin.owner"
     MetadataEntry meta = entry.getValue();
     String className = meta.getType().getValueClass().getSimpleName();
     getLogger().info(key + " (" + className + ") = " + meta.getValue() + " (stored as: " + meta.getTag() + ")");
 }

    Types

    Metadata values can be of any boxed Java primitive type, String, UUID or any class in the Bukkit API that implements ConfigurationSerializable (e.g. Location, ItemStack, etc.). Note, however, that ConfigurationSerializable instances are serialised to YAML and are therefore not as efficient as simpler types. Support for additional types can be added using MetadataTypeManager.addType(MetadataType).

    Null

    An unset metadata value is indistinguishable from one that has been set to null. You can clear a metadata value by calling clear(Entity, Plugin, String), or setting it to null.

    Names and Keys

    Metadata names can only contain letters, digits, underscores and hyphens. Plugin names are assumed to be that subset of valid Java class names that consist only of letters, digits and underscores. The full key of a metadata value (as exposed by getAllEntries(Entity)) is the concatenation of a plugin name, a dot ('.'), and the name argument passed to set(Entity, Plugin, String, Object), e.g. "SomePlugin.entity-owner-uuid".

    Thread Safety

    This API is not thread safe. Metadata should only be accessed from the Bukkit main thread.

    How It Works

    Metadata values are serialised into strings and stored in the scoreboard tags of entities (see Entity.getScoreboardTags()). Vanilla Minecraft code ensures that the scoreboard tags are persistent across restarts.

    A Word of Caution On Object Ownership and Mutability

    For the sake of efficiency, the metadata value passed to set(Entity, Plugin, String, Object) is cached in a MetadataEntry and the same metadata value object instance may be returned from get(Entity, Plugin, String) and MetadataEntry.getValue(). This is to avoid the overhead of deserialising the tag value repeatedly (whenever it is retrieved).

    You should treat the metadata value passed to set(Entity, Plugin, String, Object) or returned from the various getters as immutable internal state. Do not modify a metadata value that has passed into or out of the API. That would make the cached object value inconsistent with the scoreboard tag held by the Entity. Modify a clone instead.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(Entity entity,
                String pluginName,
                String name,
                Object value)
         throws EntityMetadataException
        Set a metadata value on an Entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - the Entity.
        pluginName - the name of the plugin that owns the value.
        name - the name of the value.
        value - the value.
        Throws:
        EntityMetadataException - if the entity is null, the key (<plugin>.<name>) contains nulls or invalid characters or the value is an unsupported type.

      • key

        public String key(String pluginName,
                  String name)
           throws EntityMetadataException
        Format the key of metadata.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - the name of the plugin; must be only letters, digits and underscores.
        name - the name of the metadata; must be only letters, digits, underscores and hyphens.
        Returns:
        a key of the form <plugin>.<name>.
        Throws:
        EntityMetadataException - if the key would contain invalid characters.
